commands.name: Add Migration
commands.detail: This command creates a new Rails migration to add a column to an existing table. It follows the Rails naming convention and automatically generates the appropriate migration file with the correct structure.
commands.resumen: Create a Rails migration to add a new column to a table

steps.name: Generate Migration
steps.detail: Execute the Rails generator to create the migration file

variables.name: migrationType
variables.detail: Type of migration operation (Add for adding columns, Remove for removing)

variables.name: fieldName
variables.detail: The name of the field in UpperCamelCase format

variables.name: tableName
variables.detail: The name of the database table in UpperCamelCase format

variables.name: field_name
variables.detail: The name of the field in snake_case format for the database

variables.name: fieldType
variables.detail: The data type for the new column

commands.name: Create Rails Model
commands.detail: Generate a new Rails model with specified attributes. This command creates the model file, migration, and test files following Rails conventions.
commands.resumen: Create a new Rails model with attributes

steps.name: Generate Model
steps.detail: Create the Rails model with attributes

variables.name: modelName
variables.detail: Name of the model in UpperCamelCase

variables.name: attributes
variables.detail: Model attributes in format: field1:type field2:type (e.g., name:string age:integer)

commands.name: Install NPM Package
commands.detail: Install a new npm package in your project. You can choose to install it as a regular dependency or as a dev dependency.
commands.resumen: Install an npm package in the project

variables.name: packageName
variables.detail: Name of the npm package to install

variables.name: devFlag
variables.detail: Install as dev dependency or regular dependency

commands.name: Git Commit
commands.detail: Create a git commit with a formatted commit message. This helps maintain consistent commit message formatting across your team.
commands.resumen: Create a git commit with a message

variables.name: commitMessage
variables.detail: The commit message describing your changes
